intro: Digrammaria robusta, commonly known as the robust digrammaria, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a layer of translucent, waxy material. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, called gametophores, are specialized for spore production and are often clustered at the base of the leaves. The plant's ability to retain moisture makes it well adapted to humid, temperate climates.
